thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: The 10-Point.

author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
Cohn, Cohn, Gone
Gary Cohn is resigning from the White House after 14 months as President Trump’s top economic adviser, adding to staffing turmoil in the administration and helping to cause some damage to investor sentiment. The departure comes after an unsuccessful attempt by Mr. Cohn to derail or limit the scope of steel and aluminum tariffs proposed by Mr. Trump, which are facing intensifying scrutiny by the president’s aides and his party’s leaders. Despite some wins overseeing the revamp of the U.S. tax... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
